ol.li: A formal and documented risk assessment must be completed prior to undertaking any work in a confined space. Work in a confined space must be avoided and only conducted if all other options have been exhausted.
The hazards of the confined space must be abated/mitigated prior to entry. Examples of abatement include: atmospheric monitoring, ventilation, permit, PPE, signage, and Lockout Tagout Tryout.
All Confined Spaces at the site shall be identified, labeled, and documented in a register.
Documented entry procedures shall be created that include the potential hazards present in the confined space and the abatement/mitigation actions to render the space safe for human entry.
Confined space entry permit documentation must be completed and authorized by a trained person prior to any work being undertaken in a confined space.
Only competently trained and properly equipped personnel shall enter a confined space.
Ensure that an adequate communications system is in place to enable communication between people inside and outside the confined space and to summon help in an emergency.
An emergency response and rescue plan shall be established prior to entry and equipment required to execute that plan shall be present before entry begins.
Access and egress points must be in place and clear at all times.
A standby person shall be assigned to remain outside of the entrance to a confined space at all times a person is working within.
